stimulusHtml: A small sphere of mass m and charge –q is released from rest at point T. If the electric potentials at points S and T are VS and VT, respectively, what is the speed of the sphere when it reaches point S? Ignore the effects of gravity.

features.html: The figure above shows a thin, circular nonconducting sheet of positive charge uniformly distributed over its area. The radius of the sheet is R. Point O is at the center of the sheet. Point S is a distance x from the center of the sheet, and point T is a distance 4x from the center of the sheet. Assume R ≫ x.

choicesHtml: 2 q m ( V S + V T ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42E6@

4 q m ( V S + V T ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42E8@

q 2 m ( V S − V T ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@432B@

q 2 m ( V S + V T ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4320@

2 q m ( V S − V T ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@432B@
